titleStmt.title: Fontaine T. Fox et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7046

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Stanford Lincoln County Kenty
20th September 1865
Governor T E Bramlette
Dear Sir

The undersigned Witnesses the trial of A, I, Willims at the present Term of the Lincoln Circuit Court under an Indictment for horse stealing and from his deportment when on trial and the reputation of the prisoner amongst those who are acquainted with him we are unanimously of Opinion that his cause presents strng grounds for Executive clemency -- we therefore from all we have seen and heard in his case are fully of the opinion the defendant is not a fit subject for the state prison -- we therefore beg your Excellcy will pardon defendent A. I. Willims, hoping and believing this Petition will recive your Early and favorable consideration we remain your Excellencys

Friends. & ob Servts
Fon. T. Fox
M. F.
H. T. Harris,
G. W. Dunlap
John C. Cooper
T. P. Hill
S S McRoberts clk L, C, C,

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
A. J. Williams
Horse Stealing
22d Sept /65
